item.title: Fly tipping: Chair and drainpipe, 26th June
item.description:
A chair and a drainpipe have been fly tipped by the communal bins of 5 Trowbridge Road. The drainpipe is behind the black bin. Present for 2 days.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Trowbridge Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cycleway 10 blocked at junction of Webber St and The Cut. If necessary, junction should be closed to motor traffic not bikes üôÑ, 26th June
item.description:
A ‚Äúcycle lane closed‚Äù sign has appeared blocking Cycleway 10, presumably something to do with the road being narrowed due to works at the Old Vic (why have they been allowed to block the road here for several years anyway?). This is a very busy cycle route used by far more cyclists than cars. Closing it is a ludicrous decision which introduces a danger to cyclists, including children cycling to school, using this route, redirecting them onto the very main road the Cycleway was designed to avoid. If there is a hazard caused by the road narrowing here, the safe and logical solution would be to close the junction to motor traffic (with a diversion in place for them) and retain two-way cycling, rather than sending cyclists on a diversion down busy and unfamiliar roads including tricky and hazardous right turns.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Webber Street, Waterloo, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement blooked by car, 26th June
item.description:
The car has been there for two days forcing children and adults to walk into the very busy road. The owner is sleeping in the car and defecating outside local properties and throwing used toilet paper into the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 63-65, Chislehurst Road, Bickley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging brambles and nettles along the fence/wall by the river, 26th June
item.description:
Large and dangerous overhanging bramble hanging at face height onto the pavement and stinging nettles along the grave verge between the pavement and the fence/wall next to the river. Some people have tried to break them or fold them back into the vegetation but still right in the way when you‚Äôre walking in the pavement. Between the wall overlooking the river opposite the Bew entrance to Crayfields along the fence to the waterfall. Need cutting back asap.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Main Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
